intro: Hyacinthella leucophaea var. rumelica, commonly known as the white-flowered hyacinthella, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe. It belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its slender, grass-like foliage. The plant produces clusters of small, white, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in early spring. It prefers well-drained soils and full sun to partial shade, making it suitable for rock gardens or borders. Due to its ornamental value and rarity, it is often cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
